Data.event_text: 1 January - 2023 Ciudad Juárez prison attack Ten prison officers and four to seven inmates are killed in an armed attack on a prison in Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, in which 24-30 prisoners escaped.

links.text: -"Armed attack on Mexican jail leaves 14 dead". Deccan Herald. January 2, 2023. Retrieved January 3, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 3 January - Five gunmen and two security force members are killed during a gun battle while searching for 30 inmates who escaped two days ago during the Juárez prison attack.

links.text: -"Mexico prison break: Hunt for escapees turns deadly". BBC News. January 3, 2023. Retrieved January 3, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 5 January - 2023 Sinaloa unrest The army arrests Ovidio Guzmán López, the son of incarcerated drug lord Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán, in Culiacán, Sinaloa. Unrest ensues in the state, with schools and airports closed. Ten soldiers, a police officer and 19 cartel members are killed.

links.text: -"El Chapo's son, Ovidio Guzmán-López, arrested amid violence". BBC News. January 5, 2023. Retrieved January 5, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 7 January - 2023 Mexico City Metro train crash One person is killed and dozens of others are injured when two trains crash on Line 3 of the Mexico City Metro in Mexico City.

links.text: -Thrower, Antony (January 7, 2023). "One killed and 57 injured after two trains collide in horror crash". mirror. Retrieved January 8, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 28 February - Nuevo Laredo military shooting Soldiers open fire on a pickup truck carrying unarmed civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, killing five people, sparking protests and riots by local people.

links.text: -Peña, Alfredo. "Mexican troops, border residents clash after 5 shot, killed in Nuevo Laredo". El Paso Times. Retrieved February 28, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 13 March - Secondary student Norma Lizbeth Ramos died weeks after being beaten by her bully and classmate Azahara Martínez. Ramos was hit multiple times with a rock in the face and head by Martínez. The event was recorded and the video went viral due to violence, school bullying and discrimination in the event.

links.text: -"Tras muerte de Norma Lizbeth por bullying, AMLO pide 'fortalecer valores'" [After the death of Norma Lizbeth due to bullying, AMLO asks to 'strengthen values']. El Universal (in Spanish). March 18, 2023. Retrieved March 18, 2023.-

-Escobar, Dalila (March 17, 2023). "AMLO llama a fortalecer valores familiares para enfrentar el bullying tras muerte de Norma Lizbeth" [AMLO calls to strengthen "family values" for confront bullying after the death of Norma Lizbeth]. Proceso (in Spanish). Retrieved March 18, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 28 March - Ciudad Juárez migrant center fire Central and South American detainees at a migrant center in Ciudad Juárez deliberately set fire to their mattresses, killing 38 people and injuring 28 others.

links.text: -"Video shows guards walking away during fire that killed 38". AP NEWS. March 28, 2023. Retrieved April 7, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1 April - Two people are killed and another is injured when a hot air balloon catches fire near Teotihuacan, State of Mexico.

links.text: -"2 dead in hot air balloon accident outside of Mexico City". AP NEWS. April 2, 2023. Retrieved April 10, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 18 April - Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador accuses the United States Department of Defense of spying and says that he will classify information from the Mexican Armed Forces.

links.text: -"Mexican president accuses Pentagon of spying, vows to restrict military information". Reuters. April 18, 2023. Retrieved April 19, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 12 June - Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard resigns and announces he will run for president of Mexico in the 2024 elections. The mayor of Mexico City, Claudia Sheinbaum, also announces that she will resign on 16 June to focus on running for president.

links.text: -"Top Mexican officials resign in preparation for presidential runs". www.aljazeera.com. Retrieved June 13, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 5 July - A bus plunges into a ravine near Magdalena Peñasco, Oaxaca, killing 27 people and injuring 17 others.

links.text: -"Bus plunges into ravine in Mexico, killing as many as 27 aboard". www.aljazeera.com. Retrieved July 6, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 16 September - Ovidio Guzmán López, the son of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán, is extradited to the United States from Mexico on drug trafficking and money laundering charges.

links.text: -Graham, Dave (September 16, 2023). "Mexican capo Ovidio Guzman extradited to US in win on fentanyl war". Reuters. Retrieved September 18, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 27 September - Authorities in Nuevo León find at least twelve bodies dumped on roads in the area of Monterrey, likely related to a drug cartel operating in Tamaulipas.

links.text: -"7 corpses, 5 bags of body parts found scattered around Mexican city after "acts of disloyalty" within cartel - CBS News". www.cbsnews.com. September 27, 2023. Retrieved September 27, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 28 September - Six teenagers who were kidnapped by a group of armed men a few days ago are found dead near Villanueva, Zacatecas.

links.text: -Cid, Alejandro Santos (September 28, 2023). "Six bodies and one survivor found in search for kidnapped teens in Zacatecas, Mexico". EL PAÍS English. Retrieved September 29, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 1 October - At least 10 people were killed, and 60 were injured at Santa Cruz Church, Ciudad Madero after the church’s roof collapsed during a baptism ceremony.

links.text: -"Ten dead as Mexico church roof collapses at baptism". BBC News. October 1, 2023. Retrieved October 3, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 10 October - Hurricane Lidia makes landfall in the state of Jalisco as a Category 4 hurricane on the Saffir-Simpson scale, killing one person.

links.text: -"Hurricane LIDIA". www.nhc.noaa.gov. Retrieved October 12, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 13 October - A military helicopter crashes in Canelas Municipality, Durango, killing three people.

links.text: -"Mexican military helicopter crashes in the country's north killing 3 crew members". AP News. October 13, 2023. Retrieved October 13, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 14 October - Solar eclipse of , 2023 An annular solar eclipse is visible the Western U.S., Mexico, Central America, Colombia, and Brazil and was the 44th solar eclipse of Solar Saros 134.

links.text: -"14 October 2023 — Great American Eclipse (Annular Solar Eclipse)".-

Data.event_text: 21 October - Hurricane Norma makes landfall near Cabo San Lucas, Baja California Sur. Warnings have been issued for the states of Baja California Sur and Sinaloa.

links.text: -"Hurricane Norma makes landfall near Mexico's Los Cabos and Tammy hits tiny Barbuda in the Caribbean". AP News. October 21, 2023. Retrieved October 22, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 23 October - At least 24 people, including twelve police officers, are killed in three separate mass shootings and ambushes by unidentified assailants in Coyuca de Benítez, Guerrero, and Tacámbaro, Michoacán.

links.text: -"Armed attacks in Mexico leave 24 dead, including at least 12 police". France 24. October 24, 2023. Retrieved October 24, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 25 October - Hurricane Otis makes landfall near Acapulco, Guerrero, as a category 5 hurricane with 1-minute sustained winds of 165 miles per hour (266 km/h).

links.text: -BNO News (October 25, 2023). "Category 5 Hurricane Otis makes landfall near Acapulco, Mexico - NHC". X (formerly Twitter). Retrieved October 25, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 26 October - The Mexican government reports that at least 27 people were killed and four others are missing due to Hurricane Otis' landfall on Acapulco. The government also reports widespread flooding, significant infrastructure damage, and looting in some areas.

links.text: -"At least 27 dead in Hurricane Otis, Mexican government says". TheJournal.ie. Press Association. October 26, 2023. Retrieved October 26, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 7 November - The Zapatista Army of National Liberation announces they are dissolving the autonomous municipalities they established after 1994.

links.text: -"Mexico's Zapatista indigenous rebel movement says it is dissolving its 'autonomous municipalities'". PBS NewsHour. November 6, 2023. Retrieved November 7, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 20 November - A shootout between police and armed civilians[clarification needed] in Cuernavaca, Morelos, kills nine people, including two police officers.

links.text: -"Gun battles in Mexican city of Cuernavaca leave 9 dead, including 2 police, authorities say". AP News. November 20, 2023. Retrieved November 21, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 13 December - Six people are killed and two others are injured in a shootout between rival drug cartels in Zacatecas.

links.text: -"6 killed in reported shootout between drug cartels in northern Mexico state of Zacatecas". AP News. December 13, 2023. Retrieved December 14, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 15 December - President Andrés Manuel López Obrador inaugurates the first part of the tourist Maya Train, that runs in a rough loop around the Yucatán Peninsula. The $20 billion, 950-mile line will connect beach resorts and archaeological sites.

links.text: -"Mexico's president inaugurates first part of $20 billion tourist train project on Yucatan peninsula". AP News. December 15, 2023. Retrieved December 18, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 17 December - Salvatierra massacre Twelve people are killed during a mass shooting at a Christmas season party in Salvatierra, Guanajuato. Three others are killed and four injured at a bar in Tulum, Quintana Roo, while four are killed in Salamanca, Guanajuato.

links.text: -"16 killed in Christmas-season shootings in central Mexico state of Guanajuato". AP News. December 17, 2023. Retrieved December 18, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 22 December — Former Ecuadorian vice president Jorge Glas requests asylum.

links.text: -Tapia, Daniel (December 22, 2023). "Ecuadorean Vice President Jorge Glas reacts as he arrives to court, to attend his trial on bribery from Brazilian construction company Odebrecht, in Quito". Colorado Springs Gazette. Retrieved December 22, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 28 December — Gunmen from the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel kidnap 14 people from Texcaltitlan as retaliation for a previous incident in which 10 cartel members were killed by residents of the town.

links.text: -"Mexico says a drug cartel kidnapped 14 people from towns where angry residents killed 10 gunmen". AP News. December 28, 2023. Retrieved December 28, 2023.-

Data.event_text: 29 December — 2023 Ciudad Obregón shooting Eight people are killed and 26 others are injured in a mass shooting at a party in Ciudad Obregón, Sonora. The shooting's target, a cartel member, is among those killed.

links.text: -"Gunmen kill 6 people, wound 26 others in attack on party in northern Mexico border state". AP News. December 29, 2023. Retrieved December 30, 2023.-
